chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Romeo Newman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

records.addlTxt:
2:23 PM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup recites agreement that repeater to be dismissed. Defendant to plead to count 1 with sentence of 12 months jail concurrent with 2014CF40 and pay court costs. Defendant pleads guilty. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. State notes trailing citations to be dismissed.

Court dismisses repeater, for count 1 -  12 months jail concurrent with 2014CF40 and pay mandatory court costs. Court dismisses 22TR1561, 22TR1562 and 22TR163.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:00 AM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF183, 22TR1561, 1562, and 1563. Attorney Gramstrup indicates that they would like another status in 30 days. State is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:24 AM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup asks for another status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:22 AM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup indicates that the department will be likely be revoking the defendant, asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts pleas. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:05 AM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman in court in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Antonio Romeo Newman.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Antonio Romeo Newman
Current: 1016 Ogden Ave Apt 3, Superior, WI 54880   (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 1016 Ogden Av, Superior, WI 54880
No contact with Victim 1. No operation of a motor vehicle without license or permit.

1:41 PM Defendant Antonio Romeo Newman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Antonio Romeo Newman. Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives reading and asks for prelim. State asks for $5,000 cash bail, no contact with victim 1, no driving without a valid permit. State notes recent release from prison and notes previous criminal history. State also notes that defendant acquired charges while in prison. State notes prior FTAs and active warrants from 2013. Attorney Hoffman indicates that the defendant works full time in Superior and has resided in Superior for quite some time. Defendant indicates that he can post up to $400 and does not have any family that can assist him in posting cash. Court notes concerns over a new felony charge and FTAs. Notes absconder status for almost 9 years. Court orders $2500 cash. Conditions of no contact with Victim 1. No operation of a motor vehicle without license or permit.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
